supporting_text: The NAP outlines the priorities and interventions planned to be implemented over 2017-2021 to tackle the public health challenge of AMR in Afghanistan, emphasizing a harmonized approach across various sectors.
The NAP includes specific actions in the human health sector, such as improving awareness and understanding of AMR through effective communication, education, and training.
The NAP includes strategies for infection prevention and control in animal health and food sectors to reduce the spread of AMR.
The NAP outlines strategic interventions to reduce environmental contamination with resistance genes, resistance pathogens, and antimicrobial residues.
The NAP includes actions related to optimizing the use of antimicrobial agents in agriculture and food sectors.
The NAP includes a monitoring and evaluation plan to ensure objective review and monitoring of the implementation progress.
The NAP outlines specific timelines for various activities, classified as short term, medium term, and long term.
The document does not specify quantitative targets for AMR prevalence and antimicrobial use.
The NAP includes an operational plan and budget template for the implementation of its strategies.
The NAP includes a resource mobilization plan to estimate the investment gap for NAP-AMR.
The NAP mentions the establishment of the Intersectoral Coordination Committee on AMR for overseeing and coordinating policy decisions.
The NAP includes strategies to strengthen national regulatory authority for improved quality and safety of antimicrobials.
The NAP includes actions to introduce the concept of AMR and appropriate use of antimicrobials as part of school curricula.
The NAP includes a comprehensive communication program to promote AMR awareness targeting key stakeholders.
The NAP emphasizes strengthening Afghanistan's leadership on AMR through international collaborations.
The NAP includes strategies for strengthening laboratory capacity for AMR surveillance in humans, animals, food, and environment.
The NAP outlines the need for a coherent response in place for nationwide surveillance and stewardship for containment of AMR.
The NAP includes strategies for effective infection prevention and control in healthcare settings.
The NAP mentions the need to fast track the implementation of the Codex Alimentarius and OIE guidelines on antimicrobial resistance.
The NAP includes actions to strengthen regulations regarding the use and access to antimicrobials.
The NAP includes strategies to regulate the prescription and dispensing of antimicrobials.
The NAP emphasizes the need for research and innovation to tackle AMR.
